etymologies: mid 19th century: from Latin avunculus ‘maternal uncle’, diminutive of avus ‘grandfather’

definitions: kind and friendly towards a younger or less experienced person

examples.text: he was avuncular, reassuring, and trustworthy

shortDefinitions: kind and friendly towards younger or less experienced person

definitions: relating to the relationship between men and the children of their siblings.
shortDefinitions: relating to relationship between men and children of their siblings
